summary: Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability in ua-parser-js dependency affecting the docs package through the preset-classic dependency chain. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 7.5 and can cause availability issues, but was automatically resolved when the dependency was removed from the inventory.
userImpact: Users of the SDK documentation package were exposed to a ReDoS vulnerability that could cause service unavailability through malicious input.
rootCause: ua-parser-js versions 0.7.30-0.7.32 contain a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) vulnerability in the trim() function.
proposedFix: Upgrade ua-parser-js to version 1.0.33 or upgrade @docusaurus/preset-classic to version 2.3.0.
resolutionDetails: The issue was automatically closed by Mend when the vulnerable library was either marked as ignored or removed from the dependency inventory.
keyQuote: Versions of the package ua-parser-js from 0.7.30 and before 0.7.33...are vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) via the trim() function.
